alert.note: Alert for Eastern Windsor (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 6:58PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Windsor County through 715 PM EDT... At 657 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Claremont, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Chester, Baltimore, Springfield, Perkinsville Village, Weathersfield, Ascutney, Windsor, Cavendish, Perkinsville, Weathersfield Bow, Amsden, West Springfield, Ascutney State Park, North Springfield Lake Recreation Area, North Springfield, Downers, Gassetts and Wilgus State Park. This includes Interstate 91 between mile markers 40 and 55. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
